weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a canvas of bright sunshine, casting a warm glow over the iconic skyline. With temperatures hovering around the low sixties, there's a pleasant crispness in the air, lightly stirred by a west-southwest breeze that flirts with the trees and leaves. The sun, though shining brightly, invites hints of coolness as it dips ever so slightly, hinting at the evening to come. 

As night approaches, the allure of a slightly overcast sky begins to materialize, signaling a 20% chance of drizzle well past dawn. This fleeting expectation of dampness will likely lend an air of tranquility as the night envelops the city. To navigate these transitions, layering will be key—perhaps a light sweater atop a long-sleeved shirt, comfortable yet warm enough for the potentially cooler evening. As twilight settles, a stroll along the waterfront or perhaps a quiet moment in one of the local coffee shops would make for an ideal engagement with the ambiance of the city—perfect for those seeking a simple, grounding reprieve.
